body:
**Actionable comments posted: 1**
ü§ñ Fix all issues with AI agents ``` In @.claude/scripts/tldr_stats.py: - Around line 389-391: The progress bar is being fed cache_rate / 100 even though cache_rate is already a percentage (0‚Äì100) and progress_bar expects a 0‚Äì100 value; update the call in the block that prints cache stats to pass cache_rate (not divided) to progress_bar ‚Äî i.e., change progress_bar(cache_rate / 100, width=15) to progress_bar(cache_rate, width=15) so the bar reflects the actual cache percentage. ```
üìú Review details **Configuration used**: Path: .coderabbit.yaml **Review profile**: CHILL **Plan**: Pro
üì• Commits Reviewing files that changed from the base of the PR and between 1348af44c50663c3a1ae2c445ee14b19d895583a and 4e9f5f53d329ba200ba51b8ee56ff6f57ccee6f2.
üìí Files selected for processing (3) * `.claude/scripts/tldr_stats.py` * `.claude/skills/tldr-stats/SKILL.md` * `opc/scripts/setup/update.py`
üöß Files skipped from review as they are similar to previous changes (2) * .claude/skills/tldr-stats/SKILL.md * opc/scripts/setup/update.py
üîá Additional comments (5)
.claude/scripts/tldr_stats.py (5)
`7-11`: **LGTM!** Clear usage documentation that accurately reflects the new `--project` flag functionality. --- `13-20`: **LGTM!** Imports are properly organized and all newly added imports (`argparse`, `socket`) are utilized in the code. --- `237-238`: **LGTM!** Adding `TimeoutError` is appropriate given the socket timeout configuration. This improves clarity and ensures consistent behavior across Python versions. --- `279-288`: **LGTM!** The argparse setup is clean and correctly gates the `get_tldr_stats` call on the presence of the `--project` argument. --- `367-397`: **Overall implementation looks good.** The new project-specific stats section cleanly integrates with existing display logic. Defensive `.get()` calls with defaults ensure graceful handling when daemon stats are incomplete. Just fix the progress bar bug noted above.
‚úèÔ∏è Tip: You can disable this entire section by setting `review_details` to `false` in your review settings.
